intro: Psychotria dipteropoda, commonly known as the red-eyed wonder, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers with yellow centers, which are often mistaken for eyes, giving it its common name. It typically grows as an epiphytic plant, meaning it attaches itself to other plants without being parasitic. Psychotria dipteropoda is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
